document.title: Volunteers: The Power of Community Mediation
document.abstract: This article considers the use of volunteer mediators to reduce costs for community mediation centers (CMCs) and to offer the communities they serve effective and cost effective mediation or facilitation services.

field.name: custom_citation
field.value: Jacobs, Becky L., Volunteers: The Power of Community Mediation (May 23, 2011). Nevada Law Review, Vol. 11, No. 2, Spring 2011; University of Tennessee Legal Studies Research Paper No. 161. Available at SSRN: https://ssrn.com/abstract=1915671
